plugin_team_setup_template.template:
# {Plugin Title} - Team Setup Guide

Follow these steps to install and configure for your team.

## Installation

### Step 1: Unzip Plugin

```bash
cd your-project/.claude/plugins/
unzip pm-automation.zip
# Creates: pm-automation/
```

### Step 2: Set Up Environment

```bash
cd pm-automation
cp .env.example .env
```

Edit `.env` and set your credentials:
```bash
# .env
NOTION_API_KEY="your-api-key"
NOTION_DATABASE_ID="your-db-id"
```

### Step 3: Verify Installation

```bash
/registry:scan pm-automation
# Should show all components ready
```

### Step 4: Test Commands

```bash
/{domain}:{main_command}
# Should work if credentials are correct
```

## Team Communication

After installation, tell your team:

> **New Plugin Available**: {Plugin Title}
>
> Use the following commands:
> - `/{domain}:command1` - Description
> - `/{domain}:command2` - Description
>
> **Auto-Discovery**: When you mention certain phrases, Claude will suggest these commands.
>
> **Example**: "What should I work on?" → Claude suggests `/{domain}:{main_command}`
>
> Questions? See {Plugin Title} docs in `.claude/plugins/{plugin-name}/`

## Configuration Options

See CONFIGURATION.md for detailed configuration.

## Updating Credentials

When credentials change:

1. Update `.env` file
2. Restart your Claude Code session
3. Test: `/{domain}:{main_command}`

## Uninstalling

To remove the plugin:

```bash
rm -rf .claude/plugins/{plugin-name}/
/registry:scan  # Verify removed
```

Commands will no longer be available.

## Support

See TROUBLESHOOTING.md for common issues.

command_deprecation_template.template:
# DEPRECATED: {domain} Domain

**Status**: Deprecated (v{version})
**Sunset Date**: {date}

This domain has been split into smaller, more focused domains.

## Migration Guide

### Old Commands

| Old Command | New Command | Notes |
|-------------|-------------|-------|
| `/{old-domain}:operation1` | `/{new-domain}:operation1` | Moved to {new-domain} |
| `/{old-domain}:operation2` | `/{new-domain}:operation2` | Moved to {new-domain} |

## Timeline

- **Now**: Old commands still work
  - `/{old-domain}:operation1` redirects to `/{new-domain}:operation1`
  - No action needed

- **After {migration_period}**: Deprecated commands removed
  - Update to new commands if not yet done
  - Migration guide available at time of removal

## Why This Change?

- Smaller, focused domains are easier to maintain
- Each domain can evolve independently
- Better code reuse
- Clearer responsibilities

## Getting Help

For migration questions:
1. See migration guide above
2. Check new domain documentation
3. Ask: "How do I use {new-domain} instead?"
